content.description: White House  is currently the hardest line in Waterville, and was climbed in a very impressive effort by Dave Wetmore.  It follows a striking line up the steepest, tallest part of the House Boulder. Start with your hands crossed on two crimps and go left to a pocket in the seam. Work your way to the lip and then climb the towering arete to the top.
content.location: White House climbs the steep face and arete on the southeast corner of the boulder. As you approach the boulder from downhill on the trail, it will be the first line you see.

content.description: Projects? This is the biggest boulder in the Davis Boulders, and there are numerous lines waiting for those with the requisite power and vision.
